q: What is a point in geometry?
o: A location in space with no dimensions

q: A line extends infinitely in ______ directions.
A ray has one endpoint and extends infinitely in one direction.

o: A part of a line with two endpoints

q: Collinear points lie on the same ______.

q: An isosceles triangle has ______ equal sides.

The diagonals of a rhombus are ______.

What is the perimeter of a circle called?

q: A Reuleaux triangle has constant ______.
The Reuleaux triangle is not a Wankel engine rotor (it's a related curve).

What is the isoperimetric inequality?
o: Among all shapes of given perimeter, the circle has maximum area

q: The isoperimetric inequality states 4 * pi * A <= L^2 where A is area and L is perimeter.
Equality in the isoperimetric inequality holds only for ______.
What is Blaschke's theorem?
o: A convex body of constant width is determined by its support function

What is the ham sandwich theorem?
o: Any n measurable sets in R^n can be bisected by a single hyperplane

q: The ham sandwich theorem is a result in ______ geometry.
Borsuk's conjecture about dividing convex sets is false in high dimensions.
What is Helly's theorem about?
o: If convex sets pairwise intersect appropriately, they all have common intersection

q: Rearrange combinatorial geometry theorems by abstraction:

o: Any finite set of non-collinear points has a line through exactly two points

q: The Sylvester-Gallai theorem guarantees the existence of an ______ line.

What is the crossing number of a graph?
o: Minimum number of edge crossings in any drawing

q: K5 and K3,3 are the minimal non-planar graphs by ______ theorem.
A graph is planar if and only if it contains no K5 or K3,3 subdivision.
What is the art gallery theorem?
o: floor(n/3) guards suffice to cover a simple n-gon

q: Rearrange visibility problems by solution complexity:

o: The set of all points visible from a given point

q: The visibility polygon from a point in a simple polygon is ______.

o: Finding the minimum length path avoiding obstacles

o: Set of all pairwise sums of elements from each set

Minkowski sums are used in robot motion planning.

o: The space of all possible robot positions/orientations

o: Maps surface points to unit normal vectors on a sphere

q: The Gauss map relates surface curvature to area on the ______.
What is a developable surface?
o: A surface that can be flattened without distortion

q: Cylinders and cones are developable surfaces.
A sphere is not developable.

What is an isometry of a surface?
Gaussian curvature is invariant under ______.
This is Gauss's Theorema Egregium.
What are asymptotic curves on a surface?
o: Curves along which normal curvature vanishes

q: Rearrange surface curves by importance:

Lines of curvature are orthogonal at umbilic points.
An umbilic point has ______ principal curvatures.
What is the mean curvature?

Soap films form minimal surfaces.

What is the Plateau problem?
o: Finding minimal surface spanning a given boundary curve

q: The Plateau problem is named after physicist Joseph ______.
Douglas and Rado independently solved the Plateau problem.

What is a ruled surface?

A curved surface with no lines

q: The hyperboloid of one sheet is a ______ surface.
Doubly ruled surfaces have two families of lines through each point.
Which quadric surfaces are ruled?
o: Hyperboloid of one sheet, hyperbolic paraboloid, cones, cylinders

q: Match the quadric with its type:
What is a quadric surface?
o: A surface defined by a degree-2 polynomial in x, y, z

q: There are ______ main types of quadric surfaces.
An ellipsoid has equation x^2/a^2 + y^2/b^2 + z^2/c^2 = 1.

What is a parametric surface?
o: A surface defined by functions x(u,v), y(u,v), z(u,v)

q: The sphere can be parametrized using ______ and longitude.
A torus can be parametrized using two angle parameters.
What is the fundamental form of a surface?
o: A quadratic form measuring lengths and angles on the surface

q: Match the fundamental form with what it measures:
What is the angle excess on a sphere?
o: Sum of angles minus 180 degrees, proportional to area

q: On a sphere, angle excess equals Area / R^2.

What is the spherical law of cosines?
o: The same as plane law of cosines

In the Poincare disk, geodesics are arcs of circles perpendicular to the boundary.

What is the area of an ideal hyperbolic triangle?
An ideal triangle has all vertices at ______.
In hyperbolic geometry, similar triangles are congruent.

What is a horocycle?
o: A curve perpendicular to all geodesics through an ideal point

q: Horocycles in the upper half-plane are horizontal lines or circles tangent to the boundary.

o: A curve at constant distance from a geodesic

o: Study of geometric properties of sets using measure theory

What is the Minkowski content?
o: A measure of size using epsilon-neighborhoods

What is a convex body?
o: A compact convex set with non-empty interior

The Brunn-Minkowski inequality relates volumes of convex bodies.
What is John's ellipsoid?
o: The maximum volume ellipsoid contained in a convex body

Every 2D zonoid is a zonogon.

q: The simplex is conjectured to be the ______ for Mahler's conjecture.
Mahler's conjecture is still open for general convex bodies.

o: A polygon with all vertices at integer coordinates

q: McMullen proved the g-theorem for simplicial polytopes.

o: A graph is the 1-skeleton of a 3-polytope iff it is planar and 3-connected

q: Simple and simplicial are dual concepts for polytopes.

o: Constructing uniform polytopes from kaleidoscopic reflections

o: Cutting a shape into pieces that can form another shape

Hilbert's third problem asks about 3D dissection equivalence.
Dehn proved that cube and tetrahedron of equal volume are not equidecomposable.

o: An invariant under dissection using edge lengths and dihedral angles
